title: Ligue 1: PSG crushes Monaco 5-2 to solidify their top spot in league standings
description: Paris have now won seven and drawn one of their last eight Ligue 1 games and this result moved them four points clear of second-placed Nice. They face a crucial home Champions League clash with Newcastle United on Tuesday.

title: Washington demands explanations from New Delhi after assassination attempt against US Sikh activist
description: The United States and Canada are investigating alleged assassination attempts on Sikh activists who are being targeted by the Indian government. The September killing of a Sikh leader in Canada had already strained relations.

title: Five places to fill up on good bread in Paris
description: From the traditional baguette to 'baked bread,' the aroma of spices to roasted hazelnuts, and a dense or light texture, these five inventive boulangeries have a variety of options on offer, without an (overly) inflated pricetag.

title: A century on from the Nazi Olympics, Berlin contemplates hosting in 2036
description: While the mayor of the German capital has confirmed the city's interest, among the bid's opponents are financial concerns as well as historical arguments.

title: From the radical left to the far right, French political parties are weaponizing news stories
description: Marine Le Pen has seized on the death of young Thomas, killed during a party in a southeastern village, while Jean-Luc Mélenchon decried a racist attack on a gardener near Paris.

title: Liberia's youth shattered by another war: Drugs
description: In this West African country scarred by 14 years of civil war (1990-2003), drug use has skyrocketed. Authorities are taking stock of the extent of the crisis, but a lack of health facilities is hampering treatment efforts for users.

title: War in Gaza: First hostages released by Hamas and handed to Israeli forces
description: The International Committee of the Red Cross said that 24 hostages were released through the Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt. Qatar said there were 13 Israelis, 10 Thais, and one Filipino, and that 39 Palestinian prisoners were released by Israel

title: OGC Nice footballer Youcef Atal in custody over post on Israel-Hamas war
description: The Algerian international was suspended for seven matches after a social media post on the Israel-Hamas which prosecutors are investigating for suspected 'justification of terrorism.'

title: Amazon hit by Black Friday strikes across Europe
description: Workers walked out of several locations in the United Kingdom, Germany and Italy as Amazon employees around the world ask for higher wages and better rights.

title: The migrant families camping in front of Paris school
description: Right in the center of the French capital, a dozen migrant families set up tents every night and dismantle them at dawn, before the pupils arrive. Paris's emergency shelter hotline is overwhelmed, as winter arrives.

title: How much will the French spend on Christmas?
description: Estimates of a typical Christmas budget for a French household depend on who's asking. For this year, surveys have shown a range of answers, from less than €200 to as much as €550 over the holiday period.

title: In court, Sarkozy 'vigorously' denies wrongdoing as he appeals jail sentence
description: The former president of France is appealing a one-year jail sentence for illegal campaign financing. Prosecutors say he spent almost twice the legal limit in his 2012 presidential campaign.

title: Hospitals in northern China overwhelmed by an outbreak of respiratory diseases
description: Emergency services are inundated with pneumonia cases. However, 'no new pathogens' have officially been detected.

title: In Israel, not everyone backs truce with Hamas
description: Three organizations appealed to the Israeli Supreme Court against the agreement, which provides for a four-day truce and an exchange of 50 Israeli hostages for 150 Palestinian prisoners.

title: Far right: Voters generally prefer the original to the copy
description: Avoiding the topic of immigration when it is at the top of voters' minds is not a solution. Nor is allowing the far right to set the terms of the debate.

title: Olympic runner Oscar Pistorius granted parole, 10 years after killing Reeva Steenkamp
description: Oscar Pistorius will be released on January 5, 2024, after spending 10 years in prison for murdering the model Steenkamp, who was his girlfriend at the time.

title: Tax evasion leaks have brought €450 million to France's coffers
description: The Panama Papers alone brought in almost €200 million for the French state, thanks to the tax reassessment of 219 taxpayers – and counting.

title: Yagil Levy, military expert: 'Israel's political system is paralyzed'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, the professor of sociology and military specialist at the Open University of Israel deplores the lack of a post-war plan and denounces the dehumanization of Palestinians.

title: Paris mayor says transport 'will not be ready' for Olympics
description: Socialist mayor Anne Hidalgo said on Thursday 'there will not be enough trains' by the time the Games kick-off and during the event, this summer.

title: Giorgia Meloni wants the prime minister to be elected by universal suffrage
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has called for an extensive reform of the Italian Constitution, designed to give the prime minister direct popular legitimacy and a stable majority.

title: Four-day truce begins in Israel-Hamas war
description: The first hostages will be released later on Friday as the two sides begin the first pause in fighting in almost 7 weeks of war.

title: New Zealand's new PM unveils coalition government
description: Nearly six weeks after the election, new Prime Minister Christopher Luxon and his National Party have stitched together a three-way coalition with the conservative ACT party and populist New Zealand First.

title: COP28: Fossil fuel lobby's shadow looms over the climate conference
description: Hundreds of people linked to fossil fuels attended COP27 talks in Egypt in 2022. The trend could accelerate at the Dubai conference, especially as many countries include representatives of their national oil and gas companies in their delegations.

title: Even wars have rules. What are they?
description: VIDEO – The Israel-Hamas war has provoked widespread reactions denouncing war crimes. But what exactly are the rules of war?

title: Lobbyist David Cameron's return to UK government met with irritation and concern
description: The former prime minister's appointment as foreign secretary is not going down well. His reputation is weighed down by his recent career as a lobbyist, in particular for China.

title: US President Biden takes a dip on Thanksgiving
description: The White House confirmed that President Biden, who turned 81 on Monday, had taken part in the chilly family swim on Nantucket island, Massachusetts.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Hezbollah pledges to respect upcoming truce in Lebanon
description: Fighting between Israeli forces and Shiite militia has continued on the Lebanese border, pending the agreed ceasefire in exchange for the release of hostages held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip.
